questions.stem: An organization is considering a new initiative. Who determines that a project has business value and authorizes the work through the project charter?
questions.explanation: An executive or sponsor determines business value and authorizes the project charter, which allows the project to begin.

questions.stem: When is a project considered officially started?
choices: When the kickoff meeting is held
When the project manager drafts the business case
When the project charter is signed
When the schedule baseline is approved
questions.explanation: A project does not officially begin until the project charter has been signed by the sponsor or executive.

questions.stem: After the project charter is approved, what is the project manager expected to do next?
choices: Develop requirements and a detailed scope statement
questions.explanation: Once the charter is approved, the project manager leads planning activities such as developing requirements and defining scope.

questions.stem: Which statement best describes project and phase closure?
choices: Closure can be skipped if the project is behind schedule
Closure should only occur at the end of the project
Closure occurs at the end of each phase and at project completion and includes administrative and contract closeout
Closure is only required when contracts are involved
questions.explanation: Closure occurs at the end of each phase and at the end of the project and includes administrative and contract closeout activities.
